q: You are finding roles on Ansible Galaxy. You ran the following command in the Ansible Galaxy Command Line: $ ansible-galaxy search elasticsearch --author vc. What would be the output?

a.option: First 100 results with author name starting with vc
First 1000 results with author as vc
A result with Author whose name starts with vc
Random 100 results with author as vc

q: The community scores are evaluated based on the inputs from the Galaxy users. What is the maximum Community Score and what is the Quality Score based on?

You are importing Ansible content into the public Galaxy website. So, you have logged in using your Github Account. After logging in for the first time, what would you do to initiate the role imported directly from Travis?

a.option: Add a webhook in travis.yml file
Add a trigger method in the notification section
Set the branch to import all settings

q: What is the default name of APB set by the Galaxy with some minor changes like some of the symbols are converted to ‘_’ and and the name to lowercase?
Which of the following commands would you use to create a role in the Ansible Galaxy command line tool?

Here are some of the steps required to configure a Galaxy Server in ansible.cfg:

  1. Set the url option for each server name.
  2. Add the server_list option under the [galaxy] section to one or more server names.
  3. Create a new section for each server name.
  4. Set the API token for each server name. Arrange the given steps in the order of their execution.
You need to select an explicit Galaxy server whose value of the argument is equal to the name of the server. What would you do to perform the required operation?

a.option: Configure ANSIBLE_GALAXY_SERVER_{{ id }}_{{ key }} environment variable
